attributes.name: variant
attributes.description:
The variant changes the appearance of the textarea.
Accepted variants include standard, label-hidden, label-inline, and label-stacked.
This value defaults to standard.
Use label-hidden to hide the label but make it available to assistive technology.
Use label-inline to horizontally align the label and textarea.
Use label-stacked to place the label above the textarea.

attributes.description: A CSS class for the outer element, in addition to the component's base classes.

attributes.name: onclick
attributes.description: The action triggered when the phone number is clicked.

attributes.name: tab-index
attributes.description:
Reserved for internal use. Use tabindex instead to indicate if an element should be focusable.
A value of 0 means that the element is focusable and
participates in sequential keyboard navigation. A value of -1 means
that the element is focusable but does not participate in keyboard navigation.

attributes.name: title
attributes.description: Displays tooltip text when the mouse moves over the element.

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: Sets the phone number to display.

lightning-formatted-phone.description: Displays a phone number as a hyperlink with the tel: URL scheme.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: If present, the component is disabled and you can't interact with it.

attributes.name: display-info
attributes.description: The display configuration used to customize the way retrieved records are presented.

attributes.name: field-level-help
attributes.description: Help text detailing the purpose and function of the record picker, displayed on hover for desktop and on click for mobile

attributes.name: filter
attributes.description: The filter applied to the retrieved records.

attributes.name: label
attributes.description: The text label for the component.

attributes.name: matching-info
attributes.description: The matching configuration to customize the fields used to match the search results to the search term entered by the user.

attributes.name: message-when-bad-input
attributes.description: The error message displayed when the user enters a search term in the input but doesn't select an option.

attributes.name: object-api-name
attributes.description: The API name of the object for the retrieved records.

attributes.name: placeholder
attributes.description: The text displayed when the input is empty to prompt the user to enter a search term.

attributes.name: required
attributes.description: If present, specifies that a user must select a record. If no record is selected, the record picker is in an invalid state.

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: The ID of the record that is selected in the record picker.

attributes.name: variant
attributes.description: The variant changes the appearance of the component. The component displays the label above the combobox by default. Specify variant="label-hidden" to hide the label but make it available to assistive technology. The only variant is label-hidden.

methods.name: blur
methods.description: Remove the focus of the component.

methods.name: checkValidity
methods.description: Check if the component is in a valid state.

methods.name: clearSelection
methods.description:
Clears the selected record.
This method does not clear the search term or refresh the validity message.

methods.name: focus
methods.description: Set the focus of the component.

methods.name: reportValidity
methods.description:
Check if the component is in a valid state and refresh the validity message.
If the component is valid, it clears the validity error message.
If the component is invalid, it displays the validity error message.

methods.name: setCustomValidity
methods.description: Set a custom validity error message.

lightning-record-picker.description: A component that provides an input search field, that can search for Salesforce records.

attributes.description: Specifies a shortcut key to activate or focus an element.

attributes.description: If present, a check mark displays on the left of the menu item if it's selected.

attributes.description: The name of an icon to display after the text of the menu item.

If present, a draft indicator is shown on the menu item.
A draft indicator is denoted by blue asterisk on the left of the menu item.
When you use a draft indicator, include alternative text for accessibility using draft-alternative-text.

attributes.name: prefix-icon-name
attributes.description: The name of an icon to display before the text of the menu item.

tabindex can be set to 0 or -1.

participates in sequential keyboard navigation. The value -1 means
that the menu item is focusable but does not participate in keyboard navigation.

attributes.description: Specifies the tab order of an element (when the tab button is used for navigating).

attributes.description: Displays tooltip text when the mouse moves over the element.

attributes.description: A value associated with the menu item.

attributes.name: value
attributes.description:
The percentage value of the progress ring. The value must be a number from 0 to 100.
A value of 50 corresponds to a color fill of half the ring in a clockwise
or counterclockwise direction, depending on the direction attribute.

attributes.name: variant
attributes.description:
Changes the appearance of the progress ring.
Accepted variants include base, active-step, warning, expired, base-autocomplete.

attributes.name: direction
attributes.description:
Controls which way the color flows from the top of the ring, either clockwise or counterclockwise
Valid values include fill and drain. The fill value corresponds to a color flow in the clockwise direction.
The drain value indicates a color flow in the counterclockwise direction.

attributes.name: size
attributes.description: The size of the progress ring. Valid values include medium and large.

lightning-progress-ring.description:
Displays a circular progress indicator to provide feedback about an action or process.
This component requires API version 48.0 and later.

attributes.name: density
attributes.description:
Sets the arrangement style of fields and labels in the form.
Accepted values are compact, comfy, and auto (default).
Use compact to display fields and their labels on the same line.
Use comfy to display fields below their labels.
Use auto to let the component dynamically set
the density according to the user's Display Density setting
and the width of the form.

attributes.description: List of fields to be displayed. The fields display in the order you list them.

attributes.description:
The type of layout to use to display the form fields. Possible values: Compact, Full.
When creating a new record, only the full layout is supported.

attributes.name: mode
attributes.description:
Specifies the interaction and display style for the form.
Possible values: view, edit, readonly.
If a record ID is not provided, the default mode is edit, which displays a form to create new records.
If a record ID is provided, the default mode is view, which displays field values with edit icons on updateable fields.

attributes.description: If true, the menu items are displayed. This value defaults to false.

methods.name: access-key
methods.description: The keyboard shortcut for the button menu.

methods.name: accesskey
methods.description: Specifies a shortcut key to activate or focus an element.

methods.name: alternative-text
methods.description: The assistive text for the button.

methods.name: body
methods.description: The body of the component.

methods.name: class
methods.description: A CSS class for the outer element, in addition to the component's base classes.

methods.name: disabled
methods.description: If present, the menu can be opened by users.

methods.name: draft-alternative-text
methods.description:
Describes the reason for showing the draft indicator.
This is required when is-draft is true.

methods.name: icon-name
methods.description:
The name of the icon to be used in the format 'utility:down'.
If an icon other than 'utility:down' or 'utility:chevrondown' is used,
a utility:down icon is appended to the right of that icon.
This value defaults to utility:down.

methods.name: icon-size
methods.description:
The size of the icon.
Options include xx-small, x-small, medium, or large.
This value defaults to medium.

methods.name: is-draft
methods.description: If present, the menu trigger shows a draft indicator.

methods.name: is-loading
methods.description: If present, the menu is in a loading state and shows a spinner.

methods.name: label
methods.description: Optional text to be shown on the button.

methods.name: loading-state-alternative-text
methods.description: Message displayed while the menu is in the loading state.

methods.name: menu-alignment
methods.description:
Determines the alignment of the menu relative to the button.
Available options are: auto, left, center, right, bottom-left, bottom-center, bottom-right.
The auto option aligns the dropdown menu based on available space.
This value defaults to left.

methods.name: name
methods.description: The name for the button element. This value is optional and can be used to identify the button in a callback.

methods.name: nubbin
methods.description:
If present, a nubbin is present on the menu.
A nubbin is a stub that protrudes from the menu item towards the button menu.
The nubbin position is based on the menu-alignment.

methods.name: onblur
methods.description: The action triggered when the element releases focus.

methods.name: onfocus
methods.description: The action triggered when the element receives focus.

methods.name: onopen
methods.description: Action fired when the menu is opened.

methods.name: onselect
methods.description: Action fired when a menu item is selected. The 'detail.menuItem' property of the passed event is the selected menu item.

methods.name: tabindex
methods.description: Specifies the tab order of an element (when the tab button is used for navigating).

methods.name: title
methods.description: Displays tooltip text when the mouse moves over the button menu.

methods.name: value
methods.description:
The value for the button element.
This value is optional and can be used when submitting a form.

methods.name: variant
methods.description:
The variant changes the look of the button.
Accepted variants include bare, container, border, border-filled, bare-inverse, and border-inverse.
This value defaults to border.

methods.name: visible
methods.description: If true, the menu items are displayed. This value defaults to false.

attributes.name: center
attributes.description:
A location to use as the map's center.
If center is not specified, the map centers automatically.

attributes.name: class
attributes.description: A CSS class for the outer element, in addition to the component's base classes.

attributes.name: list-view
attributes.description:
Displays or hides the list of locations. Valid values are visible, hidden, or auto.
This value defaults to auto, which shows the list only when multiple markers are present.
Passing in an invalid value hides the list view.

attributes.name: map-markers
attributes.description:
One or more objects with the address or latitude and longitude to be displayed on the map.
If latitude and longitude are provided, the address is ignored.

attributes.name: markers-title
attributes.description:
Provides the heading title for the markers. Required if specifying multiple markers.
The title is displayed below the map as a header for the list of clickable addresses.

attributes.name: selected-marker-value
attributes.description:
Provides the value of the currently selected marker.
Returns undefined if you dont pass value to map-markers.

attributes.name: show-footer
attributes.description:
If present, the footer element is displayed below the map.
The footer shows an 'Open in Google Maps' link that opens an external window
to display the selected marker location in Google Maps. Default value is false.

attributes.name: title
attributes.description: Displays tooltip text when the mouse moves over the element.

attributes.name: zoom-level
attributes.description:
The zoom levels as defined by Google Maps API.
If a zoom level is not specified, a default zoom level is applied to accommodate all markers on the map.

lightning-map.description: Displays a map with markers for one or more locations.

attributes.name: class
attributes.description: A CSS class for the outer element, in addition to the component's base classes.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: If present, the input name field is disabled and users cannot interact with it.

attributes.name: field-level-help
attributes.description: Help text detailing the purpose and function of the input.

attributes.name: fields-to-display
attributes.description:
List of fields to be displayed on the component. This value defaults to
['firstName', 'salutation', 'lastName']. Other field values include middleName,
informalName, suffix.

attributes.name: first-name
attributes.description: Displays the First Name field.

attributes.name: first-name-label
attributes.description: Reserved for internal use.

attributes.name: informal-name
attributes.description: Displays the Informal Name field.

attributes.name: informal-name-label
attributes.description: Reserved for internal use.

attributes.name: label
attributes.description: The label of the input name field.

attributes.name: last-name
attributes.description: Displays the Last Name field.

attributes.name: last-name-label
attributes.description: Reserved for internal use.

attributes.name: middle-name
attributes.description: Displays the Middle Name field.

attributes.name: middle-name-label
attributes.description: Reserved for internal use.

attributes.name: onblur
attributes.description: The action triggered when the input releases focus.

attributes.name: onchange
attributes.description: The action triggered when the value changes.

attributes.name: onfocus
attributes.description: The action triggered when the input receives focus.

attributes.name: options
attributes.description: Displays a list of salutation options, such as Dr. or Mrs., provided as label-value pairs.

attributes.name: read-only
attributes.description: If present, the input name field is read-only and cannot be edited.

attributes.name: readonly
attributes.description: Specifies whether the compound field is read-only. This value defaults to false.

attributes.name: required
attributes.description:
If present, the input name field must be filled out before the form is submitted.
A red asterisk is displayed on the Last Name field. An error
message is displayed if a user interacts with the Last Name
field and does not provide a value.

attributes.name: salutation
attributes.description: Displays the Salutation field as a dropdown menu. Use the options attribute to provide salutations in an array of label-value pairs.

attributes.name: salutation-label
attributes.description: Reserved for internal use.

attributes.name: suffix
attributes.description: Displays the Suffix field.

attributes.name: suffix-label
attributes.description: Reserved for internal use.

attributes.name: title
attributes.description: Displays tooltip text when the mouse moves over the element.

attributes.name: validity
attributes.description: Represents the validity states that an element can be in, with respect to constraint validation.

attributes.name: variant
attributes.description:
The variant changes the appearance of a name compound field.
Accepted variants include standard, label-hidden, label-inline, and label-stacked.
This value defaults to standard.
Use label-hidden to hide the label but make it available to assistive technology.
Use label-inline to horizontally align the label and name fields.
Use label-stacked to place the label above the name fields.

attributes.name: alternative-text
attributes.description: The alternative text used to describe the reason for the wait and need for a spinner.

attributes.name: class
attributes.description: A CSS class for the outer element, in addition to the component's base classes.

attributes.name: size
attributes.description: The size of the spinner. Accepted sizes are small, medium, and large. This value defaults to medium.

attributes.name: title
attributes.description: Displays tooltip text when the mouse moves over the element.

attributes.name: variant
attributes.description:
The variant changes the appearance of the spinner.
Accepted variants include base, brand, and inverse. The default is base.

attributes.name: alternative-text
attributes.description:
The alternative text used to describe the icon.
This text should describe what happens when you click the button,
for example 'Upload File', not what the icon looks like, 'Paperclip'.

attributes.name: class
attributes.description: A CSS class for the outer element, in addition to the component's base classes.

attributes.name: icon-name
attributes.description:
The Lightning Design System name of the icon.
Names are written in the format 'utility:down' where 'utility' is the category,
and 'down' is the specific icon to be displayed.

attributes.name: size
attributes.description:
The size of the icon. Options include xx-small, x-small, small, medium, or large.
The default is medium.

attributes.name: src
attributes.description:
A uri path to a custom svg sprite, including the name of the resouce,
for example: /assets/icons/standard-sprite/svg/test.svg#icon-heart

attributes.name: title
attributes.description: Displays tooltip text when the mouse moves over the element.

attributes.name: variant
attributes.description:
The variant changes the appearance of a utility icon.
Accepted variants include inverse, success, warning, and error.
Use the inverse variant to implement a white fill in utility icons on dark backgrounds.

lightning-icon.description: Represents a visual element that provides context and enhances usability.

attributes.name: class
attributes.description: A CSS class for the outer element, in addition to the component's base classes.

attributes.name: params
attributes.description: Comma-separated list of parameters to pass to the third-party phone system.

attributes.name: record-id
attributes.description:
The Salesforce record Id that's associated with the phone number.
This Id is passed by the component and does not get validated.

attributes.name: title
attributes.description: Displays tooltip text when the mouse moves over the element.

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: The phone number to be dialed.

lightning-click-to-dial.description: Renders a formatted phone number as click-to-dial enabled or disabled for Open CTI and Voice.

attributes.name: class
attributes.description: A CSS class for the outer element, in addition to the component's base classes.

attributes.name: href
attributes.description: The URL of the page that the navigation item goes to.

attributes.name: label
attributes.description: The text displayed for the navigation item.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description:
A unique identifier for the navigation item.
The name is used by the `select` event on lightning-vertical-navigation to identify which item is selected.

attributes.name: title
attributes.description: Displays tooltip text when the mouse moves over the element.

lightning-vertical-navigation-item.description: A text-only link within lightning-vertical-navigation-section or lightning-vertical-navigation-overflow.

attributes.name: class
attributes.description: A CSS class for the outer element, in addition to the component's base classes.

attributes.name: currency-code
attributes.description:
Only used if format-style='currency', this attribute determines which currency is
displayed. Possible values are the ISO 4217 currency codes, such as 'USD' for the US dollar.

attributes.name: currency-display-as
attributes.description: Determines how currency is displayed. Possible values are symbol, code, and name. This value defaults to symbol.

attributes.name: format-style
attributes.description:
The number formatting style to use. Possible values are decimal, currency,
and percent. This value defaults to decimal.

attributes.name: maximum-fraction-digits
attributes.description: The maximum number of fraction digits that are allowed.

attributes.name: maximum-significant-digits
attributes.description: The maximum number of significant digits that are allowed. Possible values are from 1 to 21.

attributes.name: minimum-fraction-digits
attributes.description: The minimum number of fraction digits that are required.

attributes.name: minimum-integer-digits
attributes.description: The minimum number of integer digits that are required. Possible values are from 1 to 21.

attributes.name: minimum-significant-digits
attributes.description: The minimum number of significant digits that are required. Possible values are from 1 to 21.

attributes.name: style
attributes.description: The number formatting style to use. Possible values are decimal, currency, and percent. This value defaults to decimal.

attributes.name: title
attributes.description: Displays tooltip text when the mouse moves over the element.

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: The value to be formatted.

lightning-formatted-number.description: Displays formatted numbers for decimals, currency, and percentages.

attributes.name: class
attributes.description: A CSS class for the outer element, in addition to the component's base classes.

attributes.name: columns
attributes.description:
Array of the columns object that's used to define the data types.
Required properties include 'label', 'fieldName', and 'type'. The default type is 'text'.
See the Documentation tab for more information.

attributes.name: data
attributes.description: The array of data to be displayed.

attributes.name: default-sort-direction
attributes.description:
Specifies the default sorting direction on an unsorted column.
Valid options include 'asc' and 'desc'.
The default is 'asc' for sorting in ascending order.

attributes.name: draft-values
attributes.description: The current values per row that are provided during inline edit.

attributes.name: enable-infinite-loading
attributes.description:
If present, you can load a subset of data and then display more
when users scroll to the end of the table.
Use with the onloadmore event handler to retrieve more data.

attributes.name: errors
attributes.description:
Specifies an object containing information about cell level, row level, and table level errors.
When it's set, error messages are displayed on the table accordingly.

attributes.name: hide-checkbox-column
attributes.description: If present, the checkbox column for row selection is hidden.

attributes.name: hide-table-header
attributes.description: If present, the table header is hidden.

attributes.name: is-loading
attributes.description: If present, a spinner is shown to indicate that more data is loading.

attributes.name: key-field
attributes.description:
Required for better performance.
Associates each row with a unique ID.

attributes.name: load-more-offset
attributes.description:
Determines when to trigger infinite loading based on
how many pixels the table's scroll position is from the bottom of the table.
The default is 20.

attributes.name: max-column-width
attributes.description:
The maximum width for all columns.
The default is 1000px.

attributes.name: max-row-selection
attributes.description:
The maximum number of rows that can be selected.
Checkboxes are used for selection by default,
and radio buttons are used when maxRowSelection is 1.

attributes.name: min-column-width
attributes.description:
The minimum width for all columns.
The default is 50px.

attributes.name: oncancel
attributes.description: The action triggered when clicking on the table footer bar's cancel button during inline edit. All edited cells are reverted to their original values.

attributes.name: oncellchange
attributes.description: The action triggered when a cell's value changes after an inline edit. Returns the draftValues object.

attributes.name: onheaderaction
attributes.description: The action triggered when a header action is clicked. By default, it also closes the header actions menu. Returns the action and columnDefinition objects.

attributes.name: onloadmore
attributes.description: The action triggered when infinite loading loads more data.

attributes.name: onresize
attributes.description: The action triggered when the table renders columns the first time and every time its resized an specific column. Returns columnWidths.

attributes.name: onrowaction
attributes.description: The action triggered when a row action is clicked. By default, it also closes the row actions menu. Returns the eventDetails object.

attributes.name: onrowselection
attributes.description: The action triggered when a row is selected. Returns the selectedRows object.

attributes.name: onsave
attributes.description: The action triggered when clicking on the table footer bar's save button during inline edit. Returns the draftValues object.

attributes.name: onsort
attributes.description: The action triggered when a column is sorted. Returns fieldName and sortDirection.

attributes.name: resize-column-disabled
attributes.description: If present, column resizing is disabled.

attributes.name: resize-step
attributes.description:
The width to resize the column when a user presses left or right arrow.
The default is 10px.

attributes.name: row-number-offset
attributes.description:
Determines where to start counting the row number.
The default is 0.

attributes.name: selected-rows
attributes.description: Enables programmatic row selection with a list of key-field values.

attributes.name: show-row-number-column
attributes.description: If present, the row numbers are shown in the first column.

attributes.name: sorted-by
attributes.description:
The column fieldName that controls the sorting order.
Sort the data using the onsort event handler.

attributes.name: sorted-direction
attributes.description:
Specifies the sorting direction.
Sort the data using the onsort event handler.
Valid options include 'asc' and 'desc'.

attributes.name: suppress-bottom-bar
attributes.description: If present, the footer that displays the Save and Cancel buttons is hidden during inline editing.

attributes.name: title
attributes.description: Displays tooltip text when the mouse moves over the element.

attributes.name: wrap-text-max-lines
attributes.description:
This value specifies the number of lines after which the
content will be cut off and hidden. It must be at least 1 or more.
The text in the last line is truncated and shown with an ellipsis.

lightning-datatable.description: A table that displays rows and columns of data.

attributes.description:
Set current-step to match the value attribute of one of progress-step components.
If current-step is not provided, the value of the first progress-step component is used.

attributes.description:
If present, the current step is in error state and an error icon is displayed on the step indicator.

attributes.description:

Valid values are base or shaded. The shaded variant adds a light gray border to the step indicators.
The default is base.

the native date time input.

range, date, time, and datetime input types only. For number and range type, the max value is a
decimal number. For the date, time, and datetime types, the max value must use a valid string for the type.

attributes.description:
The minimum acceptable value for the input. Use this attribute with number,

The minimum number of characters allowed in the field.

attributes.description: Specifies the name of an input element.

attributes.name: onblur
attributes.description: The action triggered when the element releases focus.

attributes.name: onchange
attributes.description: The action triggered when a value attribute changes.

attributes.name: onfocus
attributes.description: The action triggered when the element receives focus.

attributes.name: pattern
attributes.description:
Specifies the regular expression that the input's value is checked against.
This attribute is supported for email, password, search, tel, text, and url types.

attributes.name: placeholder
attributes.description: Text that is displayed when the field is empty, to prompt the user for a valid entry. Use this attribute with date, email, number, password, search, tel, text, time, and url input types only.

attributes.name: read-only
attributes.description: If present, the input field is read-only and cannot be edited by users.

attributes.name: readonly
attributes.description: Specifies that an input field is read-only. This value defaults to false.

attributes.name: required
attributes.description: If present, the input field must be filled out before the form is submitted.

attributes.name: step
attributes.description:
Granularity of the value, specified as a positive floating point number.
Use this attribute with number and range input types only.
Use 'any' when granularity is not a concern. This value defaults to 1.

attributes.name: tabindex
attributes.description: Specifies the tab order of an element (when the tab button is used for navigating).

attributes.name: time-aria-controls
attributes.description:
A space-separated list of element IDs whose presence or content is controlled by the
time input when type='datetime'. On mobile devices, this is merged with aria-controls
and date-aria-controls to describe the native date time input.

attributes.name: time-aria-described-by
attributes.description:
A space-separated list of element IDs that provide descriptive labels for the time input when
type='datetime'. On mobile devices, this is merged with aria-described-by and date-aria-described-by
to describe the native date time input.

attributes.name: time-aria-label
attributes.description: Describes the time input to assistive technologies when type=datetime. On mobile devices, this label is merged with ariaLabel and dateAriaLabel to describe the native date time input.

attributes.name: time-aria-labelled-by
attributes.description:
A space-separated list of element IDs that provide labels for the time input when type='datetime'.
On mobile devices, this is merged with aria-labelled-by and date-aria-labelled-by to describe
the native date time input.

attributes.name: time-style
attributes.description:
The display style of the time when type='time' or type='datetime'. Valid values are
short (default), medium, and long. Currently, medium and long styles look the same.
On mobile devices this attribute has no effect.

attributes.name: timezone
attributes.description: Specifies the time zone used when type='datetime' only. This value defaults to the user's Salesforce time zone setting.

attributes.name: title
attributes.description: Displays tooltip text when the mouse moves over the element.

attributes.name: type
attributes.description: The type of the input. This value defaults to text.

attributes.name: validity
attributes.description: Represents the validity states that an element can be in, with respect to constraint validation.

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: Specifies the value of an input element.

attributes.name: variant
attributes.description:
The variant changes the appearance of an input field.
Accepted variants include standard, label-inline, label-hidden, and label-stacked.
This value defaults to standard, which displays the label above the field.
Use label-hidden to hide the label but make it available to assistive technology.
Use label-inline to horizontally align the label and input field.
Use label-stacked to place the label above the input field.

lightning-output-field.description: Represents a read-only display of a label, help text, and value for a field on a Salesforce object.

attributes.name: alignment-bump
attributes.description: Specifies a direction to bump the alignment of adjacent layout items. Allowed values are left, top, right, bottom.

attributes.name: body
attributes.description: The body of the component. In markup, this is everything in the body of the tag.

attributes.name: class
attributes.description: A CSS class for the outer element, in addition to the component's base classes.

attributes.name: flexibility
attributes.description:
Make the item fluid so that it absorbs any extra space in its
container or shrinks when there is less space. Allowed values are:
auto (columns grow or shrink equally as space allows),
shrink (columns shrink equally as space decreases),
no-shrink (columns don't shrink as space reduces),
grow (columns grow equally as space increases),
no-grow (columns don't grow as space increases),
no-flex (columns don't grow or shrink as space changes).
Use a comma-separated value for multiple options, such as 'auto, no-shrink'.

attributes.name: large-device-size
attributes.description:
If the viewport is divided into 12 parts, this attribute indicates
the relative space the container occupies on device-types larger than
desktop. It is expressed as an integer from 1 through 12.

attributes.name: medium-device-size
attributes.description:
If the viewport is divided into 12 parts, this attribute indicates
the relative space the container occupies on device-types larger than
tablet. It is expressed as an integer from 1 through 12.

attributes.name: padding
attributes.description:
Sets padding to either the right and left sides of a container,
or all sides of a container. Allowed values are horizontal-small,
horizontal-medium, horizontal-large, around-small, around-medium, around-large.

attributes.name: size
attributes.description:
If the viewport is divided into 12 parts, size indicates the
relative space the container occupies. Size is expressed as
an integer from 1 through 12. This applies for all device-types.

attributes.name: small-device-size
attributes.description:
If the viewport is divided into 12 parts, this attribute indicates
the relative space the container occupies on device-types larger than
mobile. It is expressed as an integer from 1 through 12.

attributes.name: title
attributes.description: Displays tooltip text when the mouse moves over the element.

lightning-layout-item.description:
The basic element in a lightning-layout component.
A layout item groups information together to define visual grids, spacing, and sections.

attributes.name: class
attributes.description: A CSS class for the outer element, in addition to the component's base classes.

attributes.name: latitude
attributes.description: The latitude of the geolocation. Latitude values must be within -90 and 90.

attributes.name: longitude
attributes.description: The longitude of the geolocation. Longitude values must be within -180 and 180.

attributes.name: title
attributes.description: Displays tooltip text when the mouse moves over the element.

lightning-formatted-location.description: Displays a geolocation in decimal degrees using the format [latitude, longitude].

attributes.name: active-section-name
attributes.description:
Expands the specified accordion sections. Section names are case-sensitive.
To support multiple expanded sections, include allow-multiple-sections-open in your markup.
By default, only the first section in the accordion is expanded.

attributes.name: allow-multiple-sections-open
attributes.description:
If present, the accordion allows multiple open sections.
Otherwise, opening a section closes another that's currently open.

attributes.name: class
attributes.description: A CSS class for the outer element, in addition to the component's base classes.

attributes.name: onsectiontoggle
attributes.description: Action fired when the open sections change, it contains all open sections.

attributes.name: title
attributes.description: Displays tooltip text when the mouse moves over the element.

lightning-accordion.description: A collection of vertically stacked sections with multiple content areas.

attributes.name: class
attributes.description: A CSS class for the outer element, in addition to the component's base classes.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: If present, the slider is disabled and users cannot interact with it.

attributes.name: label
attributes.description: Text label to describe the slider. Provide your own label to describe the slider.

attributes.name: max
attributes.description: The maximum value of the input range. The default is 100.

attributes.name: message-when-bad-input
attributes.description: Error message to be displayed when a bad input is detected.

attributes.name: message-when-pattern-mismatch
attributes.description: Error message to be displayed when a pattern mismatch is detected.

attributes.name: message-when-range-overflow
attributes.description: Error message to be displayed when a range overflow is detected.

attributes.name: message-when-range-underflow
attributes.description: Error message to be displayed when a range underflow is detected.

attributes.name: message-when-step-mismatch
attributes.description: Error message to be displayed when a step mismatch is detected.

attributes.name: message-when-too-long
attributes.description: Error message to be displayed when the value is too long.

attributes.name: message-when-type-mismatch
attributes.description: Error message to be displayed when a type mismatch is detected.

attributes.name: message-when-value-missing
attributes.description: Error message to be displayed when the value is missing.

attributes.name: min
attributes.description: The minimum value of the input range. The default is 0.

attributes.name: onblur
attributes.description: The action triggered when the slider releases focus.

attributes.name: onchange
attributes.description: The action triggered when the slider value changes. You must pass any newly selected value back to the slider component to bind the new value to the slider.

attributes.name: onfocus
attributes.description: The action triggered when the slider receives focus.

attributes.name: size
attributes.description:
The size of the slider.
The default is an empty string, which sets the slider to the width of the viewport. Accepted values are x-small, small, medium, and large.

attributes.name: step
attributes.description:
The step increment value of the input range.
Example steps include 0.1, 1, or 10. The default is 1.

attributes.name: title
attributes.description: Displays tooltip text when the mouse moves over the element.

attributes.name: type
attributes.description: The type determines the orientation of the slider. Accepted values are vertical and horizontal. The default is horizontal.

attributes.name: validity
attributes.description: Represents the validity states of the slider input, with respect to constraint validation.

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: The numerical value of the slider. The default is 0.

attributes.name: variant
attributes.description:
The variant changes the appearance of the slider.
Accepted variants include standard and label-hidden.
The default is standard.

lightning-slider.description: An input range slider for specifying a value between two specified numbers.

attributes.name: class
attributes.description: A CSS class for the outer element, in addition to the component's base classes.

attributes.name: density
attributes.description:
Sets the arrangement style of fields and labels in the form.
Accepted values are compact, comfy, and auto (default).
Use compact to display fields and their labels on the same line.
Use comfy to display fields below their labels.
Use auto to let the component dynamically set
the density according to the user's Display Density setting
and the width of the form.

attributes.name: field-names
attributes.description: Reserved for internal use. Names of the fields to include in the form.

attributes.name: form-class
attributes.description: A CSS class for the form element.

attributes.name: layout-type
attributes.description: The type of layout to use to display the form fields. Possible values: Compact, Full.

attributes.name: object-api-name
attributes.description: The API name of the object.

attributes.name: onerror
attributes.description: The action triggered when there is an error on form submission.

attributes.name: onload
attributes.description: The action triggered when the form data is loaded.

attributes.name: onsubmit
attributes.description: The action triggered when the form is submitted.

attributes.name: onsuccess
attributes.description: The action triggered when the form is saved.

attributes.name: record-id
attributes.description: The ID of the record to be displayed.

attributes.name: record-type-id
attributes.description:
The ID of the record type, which is required if you created
multiple record types but don't have a default.
